dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHORUS (Cont) To the late night double feature Picture Show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SONG ends with church bells ringing joyously as the I WIDE-SCREEN.  The STILL FRAME bursts to life as the doors Catholic Church are flung open and Mendelssohn's wedding from the church organ. The young married couple, RALPH and BETTY HAPSCHATT appea crowd of friends and well-wishers throwing confetti and s excitedly. The MINISTER shakes RALPH by the hand while RALPH slips h PHOTOGRAPHERS take pictures. BRAD MAJORS, a young slightly awkward, clean-cut American twenties, comes over the congratulate RALPH.  BRAD and RA hands. RALPH Well Brad, I guess we made it huh! BRAD Well I don't think there was any doubt about that - You and Betty have been almost inseparable ever since you sat in on Dr Scott's refresher lectures. RALPH Tell you the truth Brad, she was the only reason I came in the first place. Science was never one of my favourite subjects but I sure with Dr Scott could have made it today. BRAD Yes, Janet and I are both fond of him. We drove over to see him last vacation. It's a shame his new job took him away from Denton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY, the bride, throws the bouquet. JANET catches it.  She squeals with delight. The GUESTS cheer. RALPH Hey fella.  It looks like it could be your turn next. BRAD Who knows...ha ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH & BETTY drive off.  GUESTS wave and shout, BRAD enthusiasm.  GUESTS begin to disperse. JANET & BRAD linger outside the church.  So do a stra old man with a pitchfork and his wife and daughter.  They Quaker family in "American Gothic", a painting. The MOTHER (MAGENTA) and FATHER (RIFF RAFF) stand outside doors.  Their DAUGHTER (COLUMBIA) goes inside.  The FAMIL MINISTER (FRANK N. FURTER), and the GUESTS all resemble c shall meet later at the Frank N. Furter place. JANET (who is holding the bouquet) Oh Brad, wasn't it wonderful. Didn't Betty look radiantly beautiful.   Just an hour ago she was plain old Betty Monroe.  Now she's Mrs.  Ralph Hapschatt. BRAD (Still looking after the car) Er...yes, Janet.......Ralph's a  lucky guy.  (They start to move d.s.) JANET Yes. BRAD Everyone knows Betty's a wonderful  little cook. JANET Yes. BRAD And Ralph himself will be in line for  promotion in a year or so. JANET Yes.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CHURCH DAY
dialogues.text: "WEDDING SONG" (Silent playback for dialogue) With great decision BRAD turns on JANET BRAD (spoken) Hey Janet. JANET Yes Brad. BRAD I've got something to say. JANET Uh huh. BRAD I really loved the skilful way You beat the other girls To the bride's bouquet. JANET Oh Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Singing begins) BRAD The river was deep but I swam it. FAMILY (Riff & Magenta) Janet. BRAD The future is ours so let's plan it. FAMILY (R & M) Janet. BRAD So please don't tell me to can it. FAMILY (R & M) Janet. BRAD I've one thing to say and that's Dammit, Janet. I love you. The road was long but I ran it. (He runs backwards towards church doors) FAMILY (Riff and Magenta) Janet. BRAD (Climbing onto fence) There's a fire in my heart And you fan it.  (Jumps off) FAMILY (Riff and Magenta) Janet. BRAD If there's one fool for you Then I am it. FAMILY (Riff and Magenta) Janet. BRAD (Getting chalk from pocket) I've one thing to say and that's, Dammit, Janet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He chalks a heart and arrow on the church door, which Rif to wipe off. BRAD I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET runs to him, he kneels and produces a ring. BRAD Here's a ring to prove that I'm not joker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHURCH BELLS Peal out.  RIFF & MAGENTA open doors and church, door closes behind them. BRAD There's three ways that love can grow. That's good bad or mediocre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET grabs the ring as BRAD rises.  She throws down the would fall into BRAD's arms but he goes to the door to ch again. BRAD Oh - J - A - N - E - T I love you so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET, transfixed, bursts into the church.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CHURCH DAY
dialogues.text: "WEDDING SONG"  Pt. 2 JANET bursts into the church, hypnotised by the ring.  BR JANET Oh!......It's nicer than Betty Munroe had MAGENTA (Peering up from behind pew) Oh Brad. JANET Now we're engaged and I'm so glad. MAGENTA & COLUMBIA Oh Brad.  (Both peer up and disappear) JANET That you met Mom And you know Dad. WHOLE FAMILY Oh Brad.  (peering up together) JANET (Taking his arm) I've one thing to say And that's, Brad I'm mad, For you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD & JANET start to walk d.s., arm in arm. the strange FAMILY march slowly across them l/r., in fron JANET (Laying head on Brad's sh.) Oh, Brad. BRAD Oh Dammit. JANET (Caresses his cheek) I'm mad..... BRAD Oh Janet JANET For you. BRAD (briefly kisses her) I love you too-oo-oo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD takes JANET's hands, turning to her.  We are aware o bringing in coffin in b.g. through vestry door. BRAD & JANET There's one thing left to do-ah-ooh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (They separate) BRAD And that's go see the man Who began it FAMILY (Carrying coffin) Janet. BRAD When we met in his science exam It -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FAMILY move into position behind BRAD & JANET FAMILY Janet. BRAD Made me give you the eye And then panic, FAMILY Janet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAMILY lower coffin onto floor. BRAD I've got one thing to say, and that's Dammit, Janet. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET runs to BRAD and he hugs her. BRAD (Circling Janet) Dammit, Janet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET circles BRAD twice, admiring her ring on the way. JANET Oh Brad, I'm mad. BRAD Dammit, Janet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD & JANET kneel together with each following word kneeling on the floor) BRAD, JANET, FAMILY. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD & JANET kiss. The cross above spits optically.

dialogues.speaker: INT. A STUDY NIGHT
dialogues.text: Mahogany bookcases, a large desk with a prominent globe o well-padded armchair has its back to the camera.  It swin revealing the NARRATOR.  He is in his smoking jacket.  He directly to us. NARRATOR I would like if I may to take you on a strange journey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses to the bookshelf.  He selects a dossier.  We s "The Denton Affair".  He returns to his desk and places i bookstand.  He puts on his reading glasses. NARRATOR It seemed a fairly ordinary night when Brad Majors and his fiancee Janet Weiss (two young ordinary healthy kids) left Denton that late November evening to visit Dr Everett Scott, ex. tutor and now friend of both of them.  It's true  there were dark storm clouds, heavy,  black and pendulous, toward which they  were driving.  It's true also that the  spare tyre they were carrying was badly  in need of some air.  But they being  normal kids and on a night out, well  they were not going to let a storm  spoil the events of their evening. On a night out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the book marking the place. Thunder is heard distantly on the sound track. NARRATOR It was a night out they were going to remember for a very long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lighting cracks on the sound track.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: A windscreen wiper working under strain.  Torrential rain windscreen.  BRAD concentrating on visibility.  JANET eat and listening to the car radio playing an Orson Welles se Shadow. A motorcycle roars past them. JANET Gosh.  That's the third motorcyclist that's passed us.  They certainly take their lives in their hands.  What with the weather and all. BRAD Yes, Janet.  Life's pretty cheap to that type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET takes another stick of gum. Offers BRAD some.  He declines. The car slows to a halt. JANET What's the matter Brad, darling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlights on sign reading: "DEAD END". BRAD I think we took the wrong fork a few miles back. JANET Oh dear!  But then where did the motorcyclists come from? BRAD Hmmm ... Well, I guess we will have to turn back.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ROAD NIGHT
dialogues.text: Car reverses. BRAD puts his foot on the accelerator.  The wheel skids a

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAR NIGHT
dialogues.text: JANET What was that bang? BRAD We must have a blow-out. JANET Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ROAD NIGHT
dialogues.text: A bolt of lighting strikes a tree.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAR NIGHT
dialogues.text: BRAD You'd better sit here and keep warm  while I go for help. JANET But where will you go?  We're in the  middle of nowhere. BRAD Didn't we pass a castle back down the road a few miles?  Maybe they have a telephone I might use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unbuckles his seatbelt. JANET I'm coming with you. BRAD There's no point both of us getting wet. JANET I'm coming with you. (she unbuckles her seatbelt) Besides, darling, the owner of the phone might be a beautiful woman and you may never come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD laughs. A thunderclap. MUSIC commences and she alights from the car and follows over her head.

dialogues.speaker: SONG
dialogues.text: The rain pours off the newspaper down JANET's face.  She catching up with BRAD. She sing plaintively. JANET In the velvet darkness Of the blackest night Burning bright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the two of them - BRAD striding ahead, JANET nearl with him. Behind them on the side of the road, sparse trees and roc JANET There's a guiding star No matter what or who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have passed a row of trees.  A rock formation in the castle is silhouetted against the sky.  It has a flag fly turret. Lightning strikes. A glow of light appears in a window.  It illuminates a pa castle. BRAD and JANET turn. The castle is in the distance between the two of them. BRAD & JANET There's a light

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The castle looms in the distance. PHANTOM VOICES Over at the Frankenstein place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD stares hard. BRAD There's a light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The castle looms closer. PHANTOM VOICES Burning in the fireplace. JANET (looks to Brad) There's a light, a light In the darkness of everybody's life

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking JANET by the hand, BRAD moves off the roadway towa BRAD I can see the flag fly I can see the rain Just the same There has got to be Something better here For you and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lighting strikes. JANET jumps towards BRAD. BRAD & JANET There's a light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The castle seems to move forward. PHANTOM VOICES Burning in the fireplace. BRAD There's a light.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CASTLE DRIVEWAY NIGHT
dialogues.text: A motorcycle convoy roars by revealing a hidden road to t BRAD A light In the darkness of everybody's life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy drives up and disappears into a secret entranc

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CASTLE FACADE NIGHT
dialogues.text: We see a cell-like window near a massive lighted window. face appears squinting into the darkness. RIFF RAFF The darkness must go Down the river of nights dreaming Flow morphia slow Let the sun and light come streaming Into my life.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SKY NIGHT
dialogues.text: Lightning strikes.

dialogues.speaker: CASTLE FACADE NIGHT
dialogues.text: RIFF RAFF moves to the lighted window where his hunchback becomes a giant shadow. RIFF RAFF Into my life.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CASTLE DRIVE NIGHT
dialogues.text: BRAD and JANET start moving down the driveway. BRAD & JANET There's a light.

dialogues.speaker: CASTLE FACADE NIGHT
dialogues.text: Shadow turns in the window. PHANTOM VOICES Over at the Frankenstein place.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CASTLE DRIVE NIGHT
dialogues.text: BRAD and JANET approach the gateway to the castle. BRAD & JANET There's a light.

dialogues.speaker: CASTLE FACADE NIGHT
dialogues.text: The shadow slowly covers the whole window. PHANTOM VOICES Burning in the fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CASTLE DRIVE NIGHT
dialogues.text: PHANTOM VOICES There's a light, a light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD and JANET are at the gate.  There is a rusted sign. BRAD & JANET In the darkness of everybody's life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bolt of lighting illuminates the sign which reads:  FRA SCIENTIST.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STUDY NIGHT
dialogues.text: The NARRATOR is in his armchair.  He leans forward with s NARRATOR And so it seemed that fortune had smiled on Brad and Janet and that they had found the assistance that their plight required - or had they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunderclap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD rings the doorbell.  It makes a strange sound. JANET Oh, Brad.  Let's go back.  I'm cold and I'm frightened. BRAD Just a moment, Janet.  They may have a telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens.  Throbbing music is heard in the backgrou is a party going on in the distance. The figure we have seen at the window emerges.  He is a h servant, RIFF RAFF. RIFF RAFF Hello. BRAD Uh - oh - Hi!  My name is Brad Majors. And this is my fiancee, Janet Weiss.  I - ah - wondered if you could help us.  Our car has broken down about two miles up the road.  Do you have a phone we might use? RIFF RAFF You're wet. JANET Yes, the rain has been very heavy. BRAD Yes. RIFF RAFF Yes.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CASTLE NIGHT
dialogues.text: A bolt of lighting illuminates a row of vehicles parked b

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FRONT DOOR OF CASTLE NIGHT
dialogues.text: BRAD sees them and reacts with surprise. RIFF RAFF realises BRAD has seen them. RIFF RAFF I think you had better both come inside. JANET You're too kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter apprehensively.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STAIRWAY NIGHT
dialogues.text: RIFF RAFF leads them down a stairway and beckons them to The MUSIC has become louder. JANET (sotto voce) Oh Brad, I'm frightened.  What kind of place is this? BRAD (sotto voce) Oh, it's probably some kind of hunting lodge for rich weirdos.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY NIGHT
dialogues.text: They arrive at a hallway at the bottom of the stairs.  An MAGENTA, who bears a striking physical resemblance to RIF vacuuming the stairs. RIFF RAFF This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET steps over the vacuum lead. JANET Are you - giving a party? RIFF RAFF No.  You've arrived on a rather special night.  It's one of the master's affairs. JANET Oh, lucky him. MAGENTA He's lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD and JANET look at MAGENTA, surprised by her voice. MAGENTA You're lucky, I'm lucky, we're all lucky.

dialogues.speaker: SONG
dialogues.text: BRAD and JANET are rather unnerved by this outburst from They look back to RIFF RAFF.  He is now standing by a set reflecting to infinity. RIFF RAFF It's astounding Time is fleeting Madness takes its toll But listen closely Not for very much longer I've got to keep control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGENTA gives RIFF RAFF a strange signal. RIFF RAFF starts to dance in an extraordinary fashion. RIFF RAFF I remember doing the Time Warp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD and JANET are amazed. RIFF RAFF Drinking those moments when The blackness would hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGENTA half closes her eyes in pleasure. JANET clings to BRAD. RIFF RAFF And the void would be calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIFF RAFF opens a set of double doors marked BALLROOM.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BALLROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: BRAD and JANET find themselves on a balcony of a huge bla ballroom.  At the furthest end is a throne-like chair and it, a theatre proscenium.  In the body of the room are GU the people BRAD and JANET passed on the road.  They are t Transylvanian Secret Agents - assembled on this special o all over the earth.  It is the Annual Transylvanian Conve announced by an official banner suspended over the Ballro all dressed in strange but elegant evening wear.  They ar version of the GUESTS from the Denton wedding.  A party s they throw their arms out in a plea to RIFF RAFF on the b GUESTS Let's do the Time Warp again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET falls into BRAD's arms. RIFF RAFF is ecstatic. BRAD revives JANET. GUESTS (repeating action) Let's do the Time Warp again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET faints again.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STUDY NIGHT
dialogues.text: The NARRATOR moves from his desk to the wall behind him. a chart with illustrated dance steps on it.  He gestures appropriate section of the diagram with the pointer. NARRATOR It's just a jump to the left.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BALLROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: The GUESTS leap to the left in one giant step. GUESTS (dancing) And a step to the right - right - right - right - right.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STUDY NIGHT
dialogues.text: NARRATOR points to next step on the chart. NARRATOR With your hands on your hips.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BALLROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: ALL GUESTS have hands on hips. GUESTS You bring your knees in tight. But it's the pelvic thrust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rows of GUESTS open out with pelvic thrusts. GUESTS (Cont) They really drive you insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see them from the balcony and they open out in formati GUESTS (Cont) Let's do the Time Warp again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET revives. The GUESTS re-form. GUESTS Let's do the Time Warp again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD and JANET make a run out the door.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STAIRWAY NIGHT
dialogues.text: They collide with MAGENTA who has blocked off the corrido vacuum.  She sings with menace, waving the cleaner hose d MAGENTA It's so dreamy Oh, fantasy free me So you can't see me No not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD and JANET look at each other in alarm. In another dimension. (she forces them back towards balcony) With voyeuristic intention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD blushes. Well secluded I see all With a bit of a mind flip You're into the time slip Nothing will ever seem the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are back at the balcony. You're spaced out on sensation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are at the edge of the balcony. Like you're under sedation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They force BRAD and JANET into the Ballroom proper. The GUESTS turn on them. GUESTS Let's do the Time Warp again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD and JANET are completely dismayed. GUESTS Let's do the Time Warp again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBIA, a young girl, is the household groupie.  She si band at the end of the Ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BANDSTAND NIGHT
dialogues.text: COLUMBIA Well I was walking down the street Just having a think When a snake of a guy Gave me an evil wink. Well it shook me up It took me by surprise He had a pick-up truck And the devil's eyes He stared at me And I felt a change Time meant nothing Never would again.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BALLROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: GUESTS Let's do the Time Warp again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD and JANET are reeling. GUESTS Let's do the Time Warp again.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STUDY NIGHT
dialogues.text: NARRATOR.  He has now become rather involved in the dance standing on the blotter on the top of his desk. NARRATOR It's just a jump to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumps to the left.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BALLROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: GUESTS And then a step to the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUESTS take one.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STUDY NIGHT
dialogues.text: The NARRATOR dancing on the desk. NARRATOR With your hands on your hips.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BALLROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: GUESTS You bring your knees in tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's the pelvic thrust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW TRAVELLING SHOT between their legs. That really drives you insane. Let's do the Time Warp again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone reverses direction. Let's do the Time Warp again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the GUESTS fall to the floor like flies exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BALCONY/HALLWAY NIGHT
dialogues.text: JANET Oh....Say something. BRAD Say!  Do any of you guys know the Madison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one laughs. GUESTS turn nasty.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALL/LIFT NIGHT
dialogues.text: BRAD and JANET retreat to the hall.  Behind them a lift s bearing a figure in a black cloak and a diamante stiletto time to a rhythm the band has started playing. JANET Brad, please lets get out of here. BRAD For God's sake keep a grip on yourself Janet. JANET But it seems so unhealthy here. BRAD It's just a..a party Janet. JANET Well I want to leave. BRAD We can't go anywhere until I get to a phone. JANET Then ask the butler - or someone. BRAD Let's wait awhile Janet.  We don't want  to interfere with their celebrations. JANET This isn't the Junior Chamber of  Commerce Brad. BRAD They're probably foreigners with ways  different from our own.  -  They may  do some more folk dancing. JANET Brad - I'm cold, I'm wet, and plain scared. BRAD I'm here, there's nothing to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUESTS rise, staring mesmerised at the lift. JANET sees the shoe, looks up at the face of its owner. JANET faints.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LIFT/HALL NIGHT
dialogues.text: The figure turns and throws open lift cage door.  As came the death mask above them the film changes from black and colour.  However the only colour in evidence is the red l mouth of their host.

dialogues.speaker: SONG
dialogues.text: FRANK How do you do. I see you've met my faithful handyman. He's a little brought down -  Because when you knocked He thought you were the candyman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIFF RAFF scowls.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BALLROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: FRANK Don't get strung out by the way  that I look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK strides across the Ballroom to the throne. FRANK Don't judge a book by its cover I'm not much of a man By the light of day But by night I'm one hell of a lover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET gives a silent scream. FRANK lets the cloak fall onto the throne, which reveals transvestite attire. The GUESTS scream with delight. FRANK I'm just a sweet Transvestite From Transexual Transylvania.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly moves back to BRAD and JANET, doing leg kicks. Let me show you around, maybe play you a sound You look like you're both pretty groovie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He circles them and forces them into the Ballroom. Or if you want something visual not too abysmal We could take in an old Steve Reeves movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD clumsily attempts to circle around FRANK.  FRANK mea him and greets his other guests. BRAD I'm glad we caught you at home Ah - could we use your phone We're both in a bit of a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET joins BRAD. JANET Right! BRAD We'll just say where we are Then go back to the car We don't want to be any worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK turns on them. FRANK You got caught with a flat Well how about that Well babies don't you panic By the light of the night It'll seem alright I'll get you a satanic mechanic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK turns his back on BRAD and JANET and splitting the GUESTS, departs for the other end of the Ballroom.  Strea FRANK I'm just a sweet transvestite From Transexual Transylvania.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the throne he gestures towards BRAD and JANET rather the next verse. FRANK Why dont'cha stay for the night RIFF & MAGENTA "night" Or maybe a bite RIFF & MAGENTA "bite" I could show you my favourite obsession I've been making a man With blonde hair and a tan And he's good for relieving my tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We view from OVERHEAD as the GUESTS surround him adoringl FRANK I'm just a sweet transvestite From Transexual Transylvania.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK storms down the Ballroom to the lift. I'm just a sweet transvestite. GUESTS "Sweet Transvestite" FRANK From Transexual Transylvania. GUESTS "Transylvania"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK So come up to the Lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (Cont) And see what's on the slab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (Cont) I see you shiver with anticipation

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (Cont) But maybe the rain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (Cont) Is really to blame

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK (Cont) So I'll remove the cause But not the symptom

dialogues.speaker: INT. BALLROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: On the last chord the lift has disappeared. The GUESTS applaud ecstatically. RIFF RAFF and MAGENTA close in on BRAD and JANET.  They r JANET's wet clothes. COLUMBIA moves down from the bandstand and crosses to BRA She witnesses the undressing. COLUMBIA Slowly, slowly.  It's too nice a job to rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUESTS moan softly as each piece of clothing is remov BRAD and JANET stand shivering in their underwear. There is complete silence. The GUESTS and SERVANTS are motionless. BRAD and JANET are the total object of their attention.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALL/LIFT NIGHT
dialogues.text: JANET Oh Brad. BRAD (confidentially) It's alright Janet, we'll play along for now and pull out the aces when the time is right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGENTA, COLUMBIA and GUESTS laugh politely. FRANK Tonight you are to witness a breakthrough  in biochemical research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a gasp from COLUMBIA, MAGENTA and GUESTS. FRANK And paradise is to be mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUESTS and everybody applaud.  JANET claps too, but BRAD she shouldn't. FRANK It was strange the way it happened. One of those quirks of fate really.   One of those moments when you seem  irredeemably lost:  you panic; you're  trapped; your back's against the wall. There's no way out, and then suddenly,  you get a break.  (He cracks the bones  in his hand)  All the pieces seem to  fit into place.  What a sucker you'r  been. What a fool.  The answer was there all the time.  It took a small accident  to make it happen.  An accident!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGENTA & COLUMBIA step forward one each side of him. MAGENTA & COLUMBIA (softly) An accident. FRANK That's how I discovered the secret. That elusive ingredient, that spark  that is the breath of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUESTS applaud. FRANK (Moving to tank) You see, Brad and Janet, you are fortunate. For tonight is the night that my beautiful creature is destined to be born.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STUDY NIGHT
dialogues.text: NARRATOR There are some people who say that life is an illusion, and that reality is simply a figment of our imaginations!  If this is so, then Brad and Janet are quite safe. However, the sudden departure of their host and his creation (into the seclusion of his sombre bridal suite) had left them feeling both apprehensive and uneasy. A feeling which grew as the other guests 'departed' and 'they' were shown to their separate rooms.

dialogues.text: JANET looks lost. She sits on the end of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD looks lost. He examines the TV monitor.

dialogues.text: RIFF RAFF and MAGENTA by the monitor. They switch from channel to channel. We see BRAD looking at the TV monitor. And JANET sitting on the end of the bed. JANET lies back on the bed and switches off her bedside l RIFF RAFF and MAGENTA smile at each other.

Everything's going to be alright. JANET Oh, I hope so my darling.  But let me switch on the light. BRAD No, don't do that. JANET Oh don't be so shy.

dialogues.text: BRAD reaches out to the light. No, don't put on the l...

I think you found it quite pleasurable. (he caresses Brad) Oh so soft.  So sensual. BRAD Ahhh - no - stop - I mean Janet. (shouts) Janet. FRANK Shush.  Janet's probably asleep by now. Do you want her to see you like this? BRAD Like this. (throwing Frank aside) Like how?  It's your fault - you're to blame.  I thought it was the real thing. FRANK Oh come on, Brad, admit it.  It was enjoyable, wasn't it?  There's no crime in giving yourself over to pleasure. FRANK (Switches off light) Oh Brad, you have wasted so much time already.  Janet needn't know, I won't tell her. BRAD You promise you won't tell? FRANK On my mother's grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD And that's all the time that it takes For a heart to turn to stone The sweeter the wine The harder to make the break You hear something about someone You'd thought you'd known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: INT. LABORATORY NIGHT
dialogues.text: JANET If only we hadn't made this journey. If only the car hadn't broken down. If only we were amongst friends or sane persons.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STUDY NIGHT
dialogues.text: The NARRATOR is leaning back in his armchair, cool and co NARRATOR "If" and "Only", two small words.  Words which kept repeating themselves again and again in Janet's thoughts.  But it was too late to go back now.  It was as if she were riding a giant tidal wave.  It would be folly to fight against it.  Her only chance would be to ride it out - adapt - and perhaps also to survive.

She cloth back to reveal ROCKY lying in the tank - exhausted ROCKY HORROR looks miserable. JANET Yes.  There you see it's instinctive. This room is your womb.  You returned here for one thing - security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK falls on his knees. Everywhere it's been the same GUESTS Feeling FRANK Like I'm outside in the rain GUESTS Wheeling FRANK Free to try and find a game GUESTS Dealing FRANK Cards for sorrow, Cards for pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR SCOTT switches on wind machine. I've seen blue skies Through the tears in my eyes And I realise I'm going home I'm going home. I'm going home.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BALLROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: MAGENTA who during all this has been filing her nails, lo who is in an attitude of supplication. MAGENTA How sentimental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIFF RAFF moves slowly to the stage. RIFF RAFF And also presumptuous of you.  You see when I said "we" were to return to Transylvania, I referred only to Magenta and myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK looks appalled. The GUESTS are deeply troubled, realising that they also the "We". RIFF RAFF You see, you are to remain here, in spirit anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He produces a ray gun. DR SCOTT Great Heavens, that's a laser. RIFF RAFF Yes, Dr Scott.  A laser capable of emitting a beam of pure anti-matter. BRAD You mean you're going to kill him? What's his crime? DR SCOTT You saw what became of Eddie. Society must be protected. RIFF RAFF Exactly, Dr Scott.  Now Frank N. Furter, your time has come.  Say goodbye to all this and hello to oblivion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK raises himself to his full height. FRANK Do your worse - inferior one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As RIFF RAFF pulls the trigger, COLUMBIA dashes between t She is killed instantly. RIFF RAFF fires again at FRANK. FRANK takes a leap fro the rope on the curtain.  The enti crashes under the weight.  And FRANK is crushed to death velvet and glittered facia. ROCKY breaks down completely.  Although he despised FRANK had in the world. He rushes to the body and cradles it in his arms. RIFF RAFF can stand no more. He fires a blast of laser beam at ROCKY who starts climbi towards the fox skyline. RIFF RAFF fires again and again. With the body of FRANK in his arms, ROCKY beats on his ch out a wild sound like a giant beast of the jungle. RIFF RAFF fires a sustained beam. ROCKY climbs to the top of the Fox sculpture. RIFF RAFF fires again and again. They crash to their deaths. BRAD Good God. RIFF RAFF Yes. JANET You've killed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGENTA has found the entire sequence of events quite dis MAGENTA I thought you liked them.  They liked you. RIFF RAFF They didn't like me.  They never liked me. DR SCOTT (he tries a calming hand) You did right. RIFF RAFF A decision had to be made. DR SCOTT (the big sell-out) You're OK by me. RIFF RAFF Dr Scott I'm sorry about your nephew. DR SCOTT Yes, well perhaps it was for the best. RIFF RAFF You must leave now Dr Scott while it's still possible.  We are about to beam the entire house back to the planet of transexual in the galaxy of Transylvania. Go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUESTS flee down the ballroom and out the door. We see the laughing figures of RIFF RAFF and MAGENTA maki sign to each other.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CASTLE CORRIDORS NIGHT
dialogues.text: We see BRAD and JANET fleeing with DR SCOTT following beh

dialogues.speaker: INT. BALLROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: RIFF RAFF and MAGENTA's laughter has subsided. RIFF RAFF Our noble mission is almost completed my most beautiful sister, soon we will return to the moon-drenched shores of our "androgenous" planet. MAGENTA Ah - sweet Transexual - land of night - to sing and dance once more to your dark refrains.  To take that step to the right... RIFF RAFF But it's the pelvic thrust that really drives you insane. MAGENTA And our World will do the Time Warp again.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CASTLE DAWN
dialogues.text: There is a huge explosion.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CASTLE DAWN
dialogues.text: We see the entire castle surrounded by a giant beam of li vanish into space. During the explosion sequence the film reverts optically white.

dialogues.speaker: SONG
dialogues.text: BRAD, JANET, and DR SCOTT's bodies are scattered on three surrounding a crater where the castle once was. The scene is arid and deserted.  There are remnants of DR wheelchair, EDDIE's coffin and broken objects from the la BRAD, tattered and bleeding, lifts himself up. BRAD I've done a lot God knows I've tried To find the truth I've even lied But all I know is down inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR SCOTT drags himself to his knees. BRAD & DR SCOTT I'm bleeding. JANET (revives) And super heroes Come to feast To taste the flesh Not yet deceased And al I know Is still the beast TRIO Is feeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them stand shakily on the perimeter of the c All that is left is dust and sand and wind and the sun. The CAMERA PANS from face to face in a circular movement and faster as the trio sing a chorale of hopelessness.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STUDY NIGHT
dialogues.text: The CAMERA has spun into a blur but focusses on a spinnin of the earth on the NARRATOR's desk. The NARRATOR puts his hand on the globe, stopping it. He is standing over his lectern reading from his book lik in a pulpit. NARRATOR And crawling on the planet's face Some insects called the human race Lost in time, and lost in space And meaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and goes to the door of the study. He switches off the light. VOICES OFF Meaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves the study, shutting the door. It's almost dark in the study.  Only a sinister glow insi of the earth remains.

dialogues.speaker: SONG
dialogues.text: The cast credits roll up. VOICE OVER Science Fiction - double-feature Frank has built and lost his creature Darkness has conquered Brad and Janet The servants gone to a distant planet Oh - at the late night double-feature Picture Show - I want to go - Ohh - To the late night double-feature picture show.
